author: bmwlego
title: Grimace's Race Car
review: One of my favorite old time Mcdonald Land characters, Grimace's face adorns the front of this cute little race car. Pluses include a printed slope part, 2 sets of wheels, purple bricks and 2 green plates. Like the rest of the sets in this Happy Meal promotion, the set is kind of plain but it works with this set. I wish I had more of them so I could build up my purple slope collection.

author: thisisteekay
title: Rare Pieces and Colours in a Happy Meal Toy?
review:
The build is incredibly simple, and contains only 13 pieces. That being said, four of the pieces are purple slopes. Purple was a very uncommon colour back in the day! Grimace's face was printed on an oddly smooth 33° 3x2 slope piece. I'm assuming they went smooth to get a cleaner print, but it's a pretty rare mould. Based on Bricklink, only a few non-McDonalds sets used this smooth slope.

I last built this set as a child when it was first released, but the rarity of the colour purple made this a cherished favourite of mine, as someone who loved rare colours and parts.

I couldn't ask much more out of a happy meal toy. The build is a little ugly, but it was still a great part donor.
